bomberMan.gamePlay.Controller

Class GameBoardController

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • bomberMan.gamePlay.Controller.GameBoardController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class GameBoardController
extends java.lang.Thread
    This class implements a thread for always checking if there are bombs in the game board and detonating them, as well as for deleting the invisibility power up of the bomberman when he has it. Moreover, this class contains a set of functions allows to destroy enemies, bricks , the bomberman and other bombs when bombs detonate. This class updates the board in consequence and also when the bomberman has the detonator power up, this class inserts bombs that are going to be detonated if the bomberman has the detonator power up The documentation for the methods contained in this class includes briefs descriptions of the implementations. Such descriptions should be regarded as implementation notes, rather than parts of specifications
    Author:
    Andres Felipe Rincon Gamboa

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void deleteInvisibilityPowerUp()
      This function deletes the invisibility power up from the bomberman when the delay that the bomberman has been given to have this power up expires.
      void destroyBombsAround(int i, int j)
      This functions allows to destroy bombs that are in a bomb's range of explosion given the tile(i,j) on the game board.
      void destroyBricks(int i, int j)
      This functions destroy bricks, if for (i,j) tile on the gameboard, a brick is in the bomb's range given by the cells at (i+BombRange, j), (i-Bombrange, j) (i, j+BombRange), (i, j-Bombrange)
      void destroyEnemies(int i, int j)
      This functions destroy an enemy, if for (i,j) tile on the gameboard, an enemy is in the bomb's range given by the cells at (i+BombRange, j), (i-Bombrange, j) (i, j+BombRange), (i, j-Bombrange)
      void detonateOldestBomb()
      Detonates the oldest bomb that the bomberman dropped which has a detonator.
      void detonateRegularBombs()
      * This functions detonates bombs that don't have a detonator.
      void dropBombDetonator()
      Drops a bomb that is going to be detonated
      GameBoard getBoard() 
      void killBomberman1(int i, int j)
      This functions kills the bomberman if for the (i,j) tile on the gameboard, the Bomberman is in the bomb's range given by the cells at (i+BombRange, j), (i-Bombrange, j) (i, j+BombRange), (i, j-Bombrange)
      void run()
      This function executes the GameBoardController thread, which detonates bombs when their delay explosion time expires or when the bomberman detonates them.

      • GameBoardController

        Default and empty constructor of the GameBoardController.

      • GameBoardController

        public GameBoardController(GameBoard boardGame)
        This constructor creates a GameBoardController using a GameBoard object.
        Parameters:
        boardGame - representing a GameBoard object that contains all the static objects of a gameplay session, the BomberMan and the enemies.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        This function executes the GameBoardController thread, which detonates bombs when their delay explosion time expires or when the bomberman detonates them. each time a bomb explosion delay expires.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • detonateRegularBombs

        public void detonateRegularBombs()
        * This functions detonates bombs that don't have a detonator. This function displays flames on the game board for a certain delay of time and also calls other functions to destroy the objects in the bomb's range.

      • killBomberman1

        public void killBomberman1(int i,
                           int j)
        This functions kills the bomberman if for the (i,j) tile on the gameboard, the Bomberman is in the bomb's range given by the cells at (i+BombRange, j), (i-Bombrange, j) (i, j+BombRange), (i, j-Bombrange)
        Parameters:
        i - integer representing a tile coordinate from the 13x31 tiles game board.
        j - integer representing a tile coordinate from the 13x31 tiles game board.

        public void destroyBombsAround(int i,
                               int j)
        This functions allows to destroy bombs that are in a bomb's range of explosion given the tile(i,j) on the game board.
        Parameters:

        j - integer representing a column on the 13x31 tiles game board.
